The Buzz | Julep Ball out of Derby Eve lineup

Julep Ball will no longer be part of the Derby week lineup.

The Buzz | Julep Ball out of Derby Eve lineup

Kirby Adams, The Courier-Journal 4:13 p.m. EST November 19, 2014

Carson Kressley was a popular guest at the annual Julep Ball.(Photo: Getty Images)

1 CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

The Julep Ball announced Wednesday on its Facebook page that it will no longer be a part of Derby Week activities. The gala has been held annually on the evening before the Kentucky Derby since 2009.

The Buzz spoke with Michael Neumann, executive director of development for James Graham Brown Cancer Center, who says ticket sales to the party were down by a fourth in 2014. "There are too many events like this (Derby Eve galas) all vying for the same dollars and celebrities, and it just wasn't worth continuing," said Neumann who also cited the drain on the center's staff time, plus growing expenses as reasons for pulling the plug on the party.

The Julep Ball and its predecessor, the Mint Jubilee, have generated more than $1.5 million over the past decade to support the work of the James Graham Brown Cancer Center.

Neumann says the center will continue to support third-party events to raise funds and awareness. A recent fundraiser in conjunction with the opening of the Outlets of the Bluegrass raised more than $90,000 for the cancer center.

You may reach Kirby Adams at kadams@courier-journal.com and on Twitter @KirbyLouisville.
